snippet: President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China also planned to discuss issues of economics during their talks, and Mr. Obama has been urged to bring up human rights.
abstract: Pres Obama, midway through talks with Pres Xi Jinping of China, says there is no parallel between cyberattacks on American businesses and government interests that it blames on China and the United States government's surveillance of phone and Internet traffic to foil terrorists.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and STEVEN LEE MYERS
byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Beijing, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China also planned to discuss issues of economics during their talks, and Mr. Obama has been urged to bring up human rights.

headline.seo: Obama and Xi Tackle Cybersecurity as Talks Begin
headline.main: Obama and Xi Tackle Cybersecurity as Talks Begin in California
headline.print_headline: Obama and Xi Tackle Cybersecurity as Talks Begin in California

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
